subject: Football
Franchises
Free Agents (Sports)
lead_paragraph: Baltimore used the franchise tag on the Pro Bowl linebacker Terrell Suggs for the second consecutive year, which costs the team $10.2 million against the 2009 salary cap. Suggs, a three-time Pro Bowl selection who led the team with eight sacks while recording a career-high 102 tackles last season, was scheduled to become an unrestricted free agent. He played last season under an $8.5 million franchise tag. The Ravens have been negotiating with Suggs’s agent for the last few seasons in hopes of striking a long-term deal. ¶The San Diego Chargers have placed the nonexclusive franchise tag on Darren Sproles, a running back and kick returner who had a huge playoff game against the Indianapolis Colts. Sproles can still negotiate with other teams. If he receives an offer, the Chargers can either match it or receive two first-round draft choices as compensation. chargers ¶New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady said his recovery from knee surgery remained on schedule and he did not see any reason he would not be ready for the 2009 opener. brady.
